text:
There is incorrect rendering of SVG paths withPDF transcoder in some cases :
- example 1 : path is magnified and rotated in the PDF document, the stroke
width is modified too
- example 2 : "artefact" in the resulting PDF document 

See attached files fop-test1.svg and fop-test2.svg. These examples are coming
from Java code rendered and converted to SVG through Batik. The resulting SVG
files were simplified to show the effect.
creator: herve.girod@club-internet.fr
herve.girod@club-internet.fr
text:
Sorry to leave this bug as "SVG Rasterizer". Don't seem to belong to this
category, but this was the closest I could find...

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
I've had a quick look and found that the EPS Transcoder didn't have that 
problem. I saw that shapes are painted differently. Obviously, the PDF 
Transcoder tries to off-load the transformations to the PDF interpreter 
whereas the EPS transcoder let's AWT do the transformation. When I changed 
PDFGraphics2D to use the same method as PSGraphics2D the problem went away. 
I'll attach a patch the does that. I haven't committed that fix to CVS, yet, 
as I have done no extensive testing about possible side-effects and don't have 
time for that right now. There probably needs to be a discussion how this 
should be done in the first place. At least you should be able to get your 
examples working as a quick work-around. I hope that helps.

Thanks for simplifying the SVGs to make our lives easier!

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 15326
Quick and dirty patch for working around the problem

creator: herve.girod@club-internet.fr
text: Thanks !! I will use it soon.
Appears to be fixed in pdf-transcoder.
creator: cam@apache.org
